00037 double comp_clock_period[kMaxComps];

00100 /*-- init routine --------------------------------------------------*/
00101 
00102 INT MCaenCompProcessRaw_init(void)
00103 {
00104   HNDLE hKey;
00105 
00106   // Search through the ODB for the CAENs' clock and wiring information
00107   for (int caen = 0; caen < kMaxCaens; caen++) {
00108     for (int crate = 1; crate <= kMaxCrates; crate++) {
00109       char key_path[80];
00110       char key_name[80];
00111       sprintf(key_path, "Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/CAEN %d", crate, caen);
00112       if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, key_path, &hKey) == SUCCESS) {
00113 
00114         // get the clock information
00115         sprintf(key_name, "%s/ext clock frequency MHz", key_path);
00116         int caen_freq;
00117         int size = sizeof(caen_freq);
00118         db_get_value(hDB, 0, key_name, &caen_freq, &size, TID_INT, 0);
00119         if (caen_freq != 25) {
00120           fprintf(stderr, "Error: CAEN %d clock freq found as %d, should be 25 (ODB problem)\n", caen, caen_freq);
00121         }
00122         caen_clock_period[caen] = 1000.0/caen_freq/32;
00123 
00124         // get the wiring information
00125         sprintf(key_name, "%s/wiring/channel", key_path);
00126         int caen_wiring[kNumCaenChannels];
00127         size = sizeof(caen_wiring);
00128         db_get_value(hDB, 0, key_name, caen_wiring, &size, TID_INT, 0);
00129         for (int chan = 0; chan < kNumCaenChannels; chan++) {
00130           caen_wiring_map[chan][caen] = caen_wiring[chan];
00131         }
00132 
00133         break;
00134       }
00135     }
00136   }
00137 
00138   // Search through the ODB for the COMPs' clock and wiring information
00139   for (int comp = 0; comp < kMaxComps; comp++) {
00140     for (int crate = 1; crate <= kMaxCrates; crate++) {
00141       char key_path[80];
00142       char key_name[80];      
00143       sprintf(key_path, "Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/COMP %d", crate, comp);
00144       if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, key_path, &hKey) == SUCCESS) {
00145         
00146         // get the clock information
00147         sprintf(key_name, "%s/ext clock frequency MHz", key_path);
00148         int comp_freq;
00149         int size = sizeof(comp_freq);
00150         db_get_value(hDB, 0, key_name, &comp_freq, &size, TID_INT, 0);
00151         if (comp_freq != 50) {
00152           fprintf(stderr, "Error: COMP %d clock freq found as %d, should be 50 (ODB problem)\n", comp, comp_freq);
00153         }
00154         comp_clock_period[comp] = 1500.0/comp_freq;
00155         
00156         // get the wiring information
00157         for (int fpga = 0; fpga < kMaxCompFpgas; fpga++) {
00158           sprintf(key_name, "%s/wiring/FPGA %d/channel", key_path, fpga);
00159           if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, key_name, &hKey) == SUCCESS) {
00160             int comp_wiring[kNumCompFpgaChannels];
00161             size = sizeof(comp_wiring);
00162             db_get_value(hDB, 0, key_name, comp_wiring, &size, TID_INT, 0);
00163             for (int chan = 0; chan < kNumCompFpgaChannels; chan++) {
00164               comp_wiring_map[chan][fpga][comp] = comp_wiring[chan];
00165             }
00166           }
00167         }
00168 
00169         break;
00170       }
00171     }
00172   }
00173 
00174   // Create the hit streams
00175   for (int stream=0; stream<max_streams; stream++) {
00176     temp_hits[stream] = new channel_hit[initial_stream_size];
00177     temp_hits_size[stream] = initial_stream_size;
00178   }
00179 
00180   // Create a stream for CAEN trailing edge times
00181   caen_trailing_hits = new caen_hit[max_caen_trailing_hits];
00182 
00183   // Set CAEN-specific histogram initialization flags to false
00184   for(int caen = 0; caen < kMaxCaens; caen++) {
00185     caen_histograms_inited[caen] = false;
00186   }
00187 
00188   // Set COMP-specific histogram initialization flags to false
00189   for(int comp = 0; comp < kMaxComps; comp++) {
00190     comp_histograms_inited[comp] = false;
00191   }
00192 
00193   // Define general CAEN/COMP histograms
00194   char name[80], title[80];
00195 
00196   sprintf(name,  "blocks_skipped_caen_error");
00197   sprintf(title, "Blocks skipped due to CAEN errors");
00198   hCaenErrorBlocksSkipped = new TH1D(name, title, 
00199                                      kMaxEvents, 0.5, kMaxEvents+0.5);
00200 
00201   sprintf(name,  "blocks_skipped_comp_error");
00202   sprintf(title, "Blocks skipped due to irresolvable COMP errors");
00203   hCompErrorBlocksSkipped = new TH1D(name, title, 
00204                                      kMaxEvents, 0.5, kMaxEvents+0.5);
00205 
00206   return SUCCESS;
00207 }
00208 
00209 /*-- event routine -------------------------------------------------*/
00210 
00211 INT MCaenCompProcessRaw(EVENT_HEADER *pheader, void *pevent)
00212 {
00213   int num_hits[max_streams];
00214   int stream = 0;
00215   bool skip_block = false;
00216 
00217   // Process CAEN data.
00218   int num_caen_trailing_hits = 0;
00219   for(int caen = 0; caen < kMaxCaens; caen++) {
00220     bool bad_block = false;
00221     num_hits[stream] = make_caen(caen, pevent, &temp_hits[stream], 
00222                           &temp_hits_size[stream], &bad_block, 
00223                           caen_trailing_hits, &num_caen_trailing_hits);
00224     if(bad_block) skip_block = true;
00225     if(num_hits[stream] != 0) {
00226       stream++;
00227     }
00228   }
00229 
00230   if(skip_block) {
00231     fprintf(stderr, "Skipping block %d due to CAEN processing errors.\n", pheader->serial_number);
00232     hCaenErrorBlocksSkipped->Fill(pheader->serial_number);
00233     return ANA_SKIP;
00234   }
00235 
00236   // Process COMP data.
00237   for(int comp = 0; comp < kMaxComps; comp++) {
00238     bool bad_block = false;
00239     num_hits[stream] = make_comp(comp, pevent, &temp_hits[stream], 
00240                                   &temp_hits_size[stream], &bad_block);
00241     if(bad_block) skip_block = true;
00242     if(num_hits[stream] != 0) {
00243       stream++;
00244     }
00245   }
00246 
00247   if(skip_block) {
00248     fprintf(stderr, "Skipping block %d due to COMP processing errors.\n", pheader->serial_number);
00249     hCompErrorBlocksSkipped->Fill(pheader->serial_number);
00250     return ANA_SKIP;
00251   }
00252 
00253   // Merge all CAEN and COMP data streams together into "HITS"
00254   channel_hit *output_bank;
00255   bk_create(pevent, "HITS", TID_DWORD, (DWORD *) &output_bank);
00256   int output_bank_size = merge_hits(stream, num_hits, temp_hits, output_bank);
00257   bk_close(pevent, output_bank + output_bank_size);
00258 
00259   // Write the CAEN trailing edge hit info into bank "CAET"
00260   caen_hit *caen_trailing_hit_bank;
00261   bk_create(pevent, "CAET", TID_DWORD, (DWORD *) &caen_trailing_hit_bank);
00262   for (int index = 0; index < num_caen_trailing_hits; index++) {
00263     caen_trailing_hit_bank[index].time = caen_trailing_hits[index].time;
00264     caen_trailing_hit_bank[index].caen = caen_trailing_hits[index].caen;
00265   }
00266   bk_close(pevent, caen_trailing_hit_bank + num_caen_trailing_hits);
00267 
00268   return SUCCESS;
00269 }
00270 
00271 /*-- subroutine ----------------------------------------------------*/
00272 
00273 void double_stream_size(channel_hit **output_bank_handle, int *output_bank_size)
00274 {
00275   int new_output_bank_size = *output_bank_size * 2;
00276   channel_hit *new_output_bank = new channel_hit[new_output_bank_size];
00277   memcpy(new_output_bank, *output_bank_handle, 
00278                   *output_bank_size*sizeof(channel_hit));
00279   delete[] *output_bank_handle;
00280   *output_bank_handle = new_output_bank;
00281   *output_bank_size = new_output_bank_size;
00282 }
00283 
00284 int hits_compare(const void *p1, const void *p2)
00285 {
00286   channel_hit *hit1 = (channel_hit *) p1;
00287   channel_hit *hit2 = (channel_hit *) p2;
00288 
00289   if(hit1->time > hit2->time) {
00290     return 1;
00291   } else if(hit1->time < hit2->time) {
00292     return -1;
00293   } else {
00294     return 0;
00295   }
00296 }
00297 
00298 void sort_hits(int num_hits, channel_hit *hits)
00299 {
00300   // For arbitrary inputs, the bubble sort is an extremely poor
00301   // algorithmic choice.  However, when the input is already nearly 
00302   // sorted, it can be a very good choice, as is the case here.
00303 
00304 /*
00305   int sorted_through = 0;
00306   channel_hit temp;
00307 
00308   while(sorted_through < num_hits-1) {
00309     for(int i = sorted_through; i < num_hits-1; i++) {
00310 
00311       if(hits[i+1].time < hits[i].time) {
00312         // If necessary, swap two adjacent elements 
00313         temp = hits[i];
00314         hits[i] = hits[i+1];
00315         hits[i+1] = temp;
00316         if(i > 0) {
00317           sorted_through = i-1;
00318         }
00319         break;
00320       } else {
00321         sorted_through = i+1;
00322       }
00323     }
00324   }
00325 */
00326         // sorry, the worst case is just too poor
00327   qsort(hits, num_hits, sizeof(channel_hit), hits_compare);
00328 
00329 }
00330 
00331 /*-- subroutine ----------------------------------------------------*/
00332 
00333 INT merge_hits(int num_streams, int *num_hits, channel_hit **hits,
00334                 channel_hit *output)
00335 {
00336   int stream_ptr[num_streams];
00337   int total_num_hits = 0;
00338 
00339   for(int stream = 0; stream < num_streams; stream++) {
00340     total_num_hits += num_hits[stream]; 
00341     stream_ptr[stream] = 0;
00342   }
00343 
00344   for(int i = 0; i < total_num_hits; i++) {
00345 
00346     // look for the stream whose top-most unused element comes first
00347     int best_stream = 0;
00348     double best_time = 1e99;
00349     for(int stream = 0; stream < num_streams; stream++) {
00350       if(stream_ptr[stream] < num_hits[stream] && 
00351          hits[stream][stream_ptr[stream]].time < best_time) {
00352         best_stream = stream;
00353         best_time = hits[stream][stream_ptr[stream]].time;      
00354       }
00355     }
00356 
00357     // copy this earliest element to the output
00358     output[i] = hits[best_stream][stream_ptr[best_stream]];
00359     stream_ptr[best_stream]++;
00360   }
00361 
00362   return total_num_hits;
00363 }
00364 
00365 /*-- subroutine ----------------------------------------------------*/
00366 
00367 INT make_caen(int caen, void *pevent, channel_hit **output_bank_handle,
00368               int *output_bank_size, bool *bad_block, 
00369               caen_hit *caen_trailing_hits, int *num_caen_trailing_hits)
00370 {
00371   channel_hit *output_bank = *output_bank_handle;
00372 
00373   // Open CAEN bank ("caen" == CAEN number)
00374   caen_word *caen_bank;
00375   char bank_name[8];
00376   sprintf(bank_name, "CAE%d", caen);
00377   int caen_bank_size = bk_locate(pevent, bank_name, (DWORD *) &caen_bank);
00378   if(caen_bank == NULL) return 0;
00379   int block_number = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pevent - 1)->serial_number;
00380 
00381   // Initialize caen-specific histograms if necessary
00382   if (!caen_histograms_inited[caen]) {
00383     init_caen_histograms(caen);
00384   }
00385 
00386   // This section loops over the CAEN data in "caen_bank" and performs 
00387   // the following tasks:
00388   //  (1) check for headers, EOBs, and DAQ-introduced error datums; 
00389   //  (2) count the numbers of rising and trailing edges;
00390   //  (3) track the linearity of the CAEN interpolator; 
00391   //  (4) calculate the absolute times of hit datums;
00392   //  (5) fill an output bank with leading edge hit info;
00393   //  (6) fill an output bank with trailing edge hit times.
00394 
00395   // Define and initialize useful arrays, counters, and flags
00396   double caen_bank_abstime[caen_bank_size];
00397   int  output_pointer = 0;
00398   int  prev_time_word = 0;
00399   int  num_overflows = 0;
00400   bool header_found = false;
00401   bool EOB_found = false;
00402   int  EOB_reported_data_count = 0;
00403   int  EOB_reported_error_status = 0;
00404   int  num_trailing_edges = 0;
00405 
00406   // Loop over the caen_bank elements
00407   for (int j=0; j<caen_bank_size; j++) {
00408     if(j<=2)
00409     // check for DAQ-introduced error datum; if found, fill appropriate histos 
00410     // and flag the block so that it can be skipped
00411     if(caen_bank[j].r2 == 3) {
00412       fprintf(stderr, "Encountered DAQ-generated error flag in block %d CAEN%d data at j=%d.\n", 
00413               block_number, caen, j);
00414       if (!(*bad_block)) {
00415         hCaenErrorDAQ[caen]->Fill(1);
00416         *bad_block = true;
00417       }
00418       int error_bits = caen_bank[j].time;
00419       for (int TDC=0; TDC<4; TDC++) {
00420         if (error_bits & (1<<TDC)) {
00421           hCaenErrorDAQ_TDCInfo[caen]->Fill(block_number, TDC);
00422         }
00423       }
00424     }
00425 
00426     // check for header datum
00427     if (caen_bank[j].r2 == 2) {
00428       header_found = true;
00429     }
00430 
00431     // check for EOB datum; if found, extract reported data count and TDC chip
00432     // error status; if TDC chip error occurred, flag the block to be skipped
00433     if(caen_bank[j].r2 == 1) {
00434       EOB_found = true;
00435       EOB_reported_data_count = (caen_bank[j].time & 0xffff);
00436       EOB_reported_error_status = (caen_bank[j].channel & 0x07);
00437       if (EOB_reported_error_status) {
00438         fprintf(stderr, "Encountered EOB error flag in block %d CAEN%d data.\n", 
00439                 block_number, caen);
00440         if (!(*bad_block)) {
00441           hCaenErrorEOB[caen]->Fill(1);
00442           *bad_block = true;
00443         }
00444       }
00445     }
00446 
00447     // in preparation for absolute timing calculations and output bank filling, 
00448     // ignore anything that isn't an ordinary datum 
00449     if(caen_bank[j].start != 0 || 
00450        caen_bank[j].r2 != 0) {
00451       continue;
00452     }
00453 
00454     // count/histogram the leading and trailing edge hit info; if there are too
00455     // many trailing edges, flag the block to be skipped
00456     if(caen_bank[j].edge == 1) {
00457       hCaenLeadingEdgesByChannel[caen]->Fill(caen_bank[j].channel);
00458       hCaenLeadingEdgesByBlock[caen]->Fill(block_number);
00459       hCaenLeadingEdges32BitInterpolator[caen]->Fill(caen_bank[j].time % 32);
00460       int parameter = caen_wiring_map[caen_bank[j].channel][caen];
00461       if (!((parameter>=6500) && (parameter<=6502))) {
00462         hCaenLeadingEdges32BitInterpolatorNoRollover[caen]->Fill(caen_bank[j].time % 32);
00463       }
00464     } else {
00465       num_trailing_edges++;
00466       if ((num_trailing_edges > kCaenTrailingEdgeLimit) && !(*bad_block)) {
00467         fprintf(stderr, "Encountered too many trailing edges in block %d CAEN%d data (%d).\n", 
00468                 block_number, caen, num_trailing_edges);
00469         hCaenErrorTrailingEdgeBlockLimit[caen]->Fill(1);
00470 //      *bad_block = true;
00471       }
00472       hCaenTrailingEdgesByChannel[caen]->Fill(caen_bank[j].channel);
00473       hCaenTrailingEdgesByBlock[caen]->Fill(block_number);
00474     }
00475 
00476     // Calculate the absolute times by dealing with time overflows: Because 
00477     // there are multiple levels of FIFO within the CAEN, backward-going times 
00478     // are normal features of the data and do not always indicate an overflow.  
00479     // Empirically, the distribution of these backward-going times seems to cut 
00480     // off at about -4000.  Meanwhile, if the minimum rate is 2.5 kHz, a backward 
00481     // step of at least 2^10 - 320000 is guaranteed for an overflow; a forward 
00482     // step of at least 320000 indicates the reversal of an overflow, which can
00483     // occur because of the multiple FIFO buffering.
00484 
00485     if(caen_bank[j].time < prev_time_word && 
00486        prev_time_word - caen_bank[j].time > 0x80000) {
00487       num_overflows++; 
00488     } else if(caen_bank[j].time > prev_time_word &&
00489               caen_bank[j].time - prev_time_word > 0x80000) {
00490       num_overflows--;
00491     }
00492     prev_time_word = caen_bank[j].time;
00493     caen_bank_abstime[j] = 
00494       caen_clock_period[caen] * (caen_bank[j].time + num_overflows*0x100000);
00495 
00496     // add leading edge hit information to the output bank 
00497     if (caen_bank[j].edge == 1) {
00498 
00499       // double size of array if necessary, copying old entries
00500       if(output_pointer >= *output_bank_size) {
00501         double_stream_size(output_bank_handle, output_bank_size);
00502         output_bank = *output_bank_handle;
00503       }
00504 
00505       output_bank[output_pointer].time = caen_bank_abstime[j];
00506       output_bank[output_pointer].parameter = 
00507         caen_wiring_map[caen_bank[j].channel][caen];
00508       output_pointer++;
00509     }
00510 
00511     // add trailing edge hit information to the caen_trailing_hits array
00512     // (after performing a caen_trailing_hits array boundary check)
00513     if (caen_bank[j].edge == 0) {
00514       if (*num_caen_trailing_hits < max_caen_trailing_hits) {
00515         caen_trailing_hits[*num_caen_trailing_hits].time = caen_bank_abstime[j];
00516         caen_trailing_hits[*num_caen_trailing_hits].caen = caen;
00517         (*num_caen_trailing_hits)++;
00518       } else if (!(*bad_block)) {
00519         fprintf(stderr, "Exceeded trailing edge data stream limit in block %d CAEN%d data.\n", 
00520                 block_number, caen);
00521         hCaenErrorTrailingEdgeStreamLimit[caen]->Fill(1);
00522         *bad_block = true;
00523       }
00524     }
00525 
00526   } // end loop over caen_bank
00527 
00528   // sort the output bank into time order
00529   sort_hits(output_pointer, output_bank);
00530 
00531   // fill diagnostic histograms
00532   double lastTime = -1;
00533   if(output_pointer != 0) {
00534     lastTime = output_bank[output_pointer-1].time;
00535   }
00536   hCaenLastTime[caen]->SetBinContent(block_number, lastTime);
00537 
00538   return output_pointer;
00539 }
00540

00542 
00543 void init_caen_histograms(int caen) 
00544 {
00545   // This subroutine initializes all caen-specific histograms as needed.
00546   char name[80], title[80];
00547   
00548   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_edges_leading_by_channel", caen);
00549   sprintf(title, "CAEN %d leading edges vs. channel", caen);
00550   hCaenLeadingEdgesByChannel[caen] = 
00551     new TH1D(name, title, kNumCaenChannels, -0.5, (kNumCaenChannels-0.5));
00552 
00553   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_edges_leading_by_block", caen);
00554   sprintf(title, "CAEN %d leading edges vs. block number", caen);
00555   hCaenLeadingEdgesByBlock[caen] =
00556     new TH1D(name, title, kMaxEvents, 0.5, kMaxEvents+0.5);
00557 
00558   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_edges_leading_32BitInterp", caen);
00559   sprintf(title, "CAEN %d leading edges' 32-bit Interpolator Dist", caen); 
00560   hCaenLeadingEdges32BitInterpolator[caen] = 
00561     new TH1D(name, title, 32, -0.5, 31.5);
00562 
00563   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_edges_leading_32BitInterp_noRollover", caen);
00564   sprintf(title, "CAEN %d leading edges' 32-bit Interpolator Dist, No Rollover", caen); 
00565   hCaenLeadingEdges32BitInterpolatorNoRollover[caen] = 
00566     new TH1D(name, title, 32, -0.5, 31.5);
00567 
00568   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_edges_trailing_by_channel", caen);
00569   sprintf(title, "CAEN %d trailing edges vs. channel", caen);
00570   hCaenTrailingEdgesByChannel[caen] = 
00571     new TH1D(name, title, kNumCaenChannels, -0.5, (kNumCaenChannels-0.5));
00572 
00573   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_edges_trailing_by_block", caen);
00574   sprintf(title, "CAEN %d trailing edges vs. block number", caen);
00575   hCaenTrailingEdgesByBlock[caen] =
00576     new TH1D(name, title, kMaxEvents, 0.5, kMaxEvents+0.5);
00577 
00578   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_error_DAQ", caen);
00579   sprintf(title, "Blocks with DAQ-inserted CAEN %d errors", caen);
00580   hCaenErrorDAQ[caen] = 
00581     new TH1D(name, title, 3, -0.5, 2.5);
00582   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_error_DAQ_by_TDC", caen);
00583   sprintf(title, "CAEN %d DAQ-inserted errors: TDC vs. block number", caen);
00584   hCaenErrorDAQ_TDCInfo[caen] = 
00585     new TH2D(name, title, kMaxEvents, 0.5, kMaxEvents+0.5, 4, -0.5, 3.5);
00586 
00587   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_error_EOB", caen);
00588   sprintf(title, "Blocks with CAEN %d EOB error flag", caen);

00591 
00592   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_error_trailing_edge_stream_limit", caen);
00593   sprintf(title, "Blocks where CAEN %d trailing edges exceeded stream limit", caen);
00594   hCaenErrorTrailingEdgeStreamLimit[caen] = 
00595     new TH1D(name, title, 3, -0.5, 2.5);
00596 
00597   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_error_trailing_edge_block_limit", caen);
00598   sprintf(title, "Blocks with too many CAEN %d trailing edges", caen);
00599   hCaenErrorTrailingEdgeBlockLimit[caen] = 
00600     new TH1D(name, title, 3, -0.5, 2.5);
00601 
00602   sprintf(name, "DAQ_caen%d_last_time", caen);
00603   sprintf(title, "CAEN %d last time vs. block number", caen);
00604   hCaenLastTime[caen] = 
00605     new TH1D(name, title, kMaxEvents, 0.5, kMaxEvents+0.5);
00606   
00607   caen_histograms_inited[caen] = true;
00608 }
00609 
00610 /*-- subroutine ----------------------------------------------------*/
00611 
00612 INT make_comp(int comp, void *pevent, channel_hit **output_bank_handle,
00613                 int *output_bank_size, bool *bad_block)
00614 {
00615   channel_hit *output_bank = *output_bank_handle;
00616   int output_pointer = 0;
00617   int block_number = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pevent - 1)->serial_number;
00618 
00619   // Open COMP bank
00620   comp_word *comp_bank;
00621   char bank_name[8];
00622   sprintf(bank_name, "CMP%d", comp);
00623   int comp_bank_size = bk_locate(pevent, bank_name, (DWORD *) &comp_bank);
00624   if(comp_bank == NULL) {
00625     return 0;
00626   }
00627 
00628   // Initialize comp-specific histograms if necessary.
00629   if (!comp_histograms_inited[comp]) {
00630     init_comp_histograms(comp);
00631   }
00632 
00633   int prev_time[kMaxCompFpgas];
00634   for(int i = 0; i < kMaxCompFpgas; i++) {
00635     prev_time[i] = 0;
00636   }
00637 
00638   int num_backwards = 0;
00639   bool gone_backwards_here[comp_bank_size];
00640   for(int i = 0; i < comp_bank_size; i++) {
00641     gone_backwards_here[i] = false;
00642   }
00643   
00644   for(int i = 0; i < comp_bank_size; i++) {
00645     int fpga = comp_bank[i].r1.fpga;
00646     int time = comp_bank[i].r1.time;
00647     int a = comp_bank[i].r1.a;
00648     int b = comp_bank[i].r1.b;
00649     
00650     // check for a backward-going time or an impossible A/B combination
00651     if((fpga >= kMaxCompFpgas) || (time < prev_time[fpga]) || (!a && !b)) {
00652       // printf("Time order error at comp %d block %d word %d (prev_time = 0x%x)\n", comp, block_number, i, prev_time[fpga]);
00653       num_backwards++;
00654 
00655       // According to Rene's note, this condition is probably caused by a 
00656       // single missing data word that throws off the synchronization.
00657       // We should try going back one word, but we need to avoid the 
00658       // possibility of an infinite loop.
00659       
00660       if(!gone_backwards_here[i]) {
00661         gone_backwards_here[i] = true;
00662         i -= 2;
00663       }
00664 
00665       continue;
00666     }
00667    
00668     prev_time[fpga] = time;
00669 
00670     // deal with word A if it is present 
00671     if(a) {
00672       i++;
00673       unsigned int word = comp_bank[i].word;
00674       for(int j = 0; j < 32; j++) {
00675         if(word & (1 << j)) {
00676 
00677           // double size of array if necessary, copying old entries
00678           if(output_pointer >= *output_bank_size) {
00679             double_stream_size(output_bank_handle, output_bank_size);
00680             output_bank = *output_bank_handle;
00681           }
00682 
00683           output_bank[output_pointer].time = comp_clock_period[comp] * time;
00684           output_bank[output_pointer].parameter = 
00685               comp_wiring_map[j][fpga][comp];
00686           output_pointer++;
00687         }
00688       }
00689     }
00690     
00691     // deal with word B if it is present 
00692     if(b) {
00693       i++;
00694       unsigned int word = comp_bank[i].word;
00695       for(int j = 0; j < 32; j++) {
00696         if(word & (1 << j)) {
00697           // double size of array if necessary, copying old entries
00698           if(output_pointer >= *output_bank_size) {
00699             double_stream_size(output_bank_handle, output_bank_size);
00700             output_bank = *output_bank_handle;
00701           }
00702 
00703           output_bank[output_pointer].time = comp_clock_period[comp] * time;
00704           output_bank[output_pointer].parameter = 
00705             comp_wiring_map[j + 32][fpga][comp];
00706           output_pointer++;
00707         }
00708       }
00709     }
00710   } 
00711 
00712   // check if there were too many time-ordering errors
00713 //  if (num_backwards > 0 && num_backwards <= 1000) {
00714   if (num_backwards > 0 && num_backwards <= 10) {
00715     fprintf(stderr, "Encountered %d backward time steps in block %d COMP%d data.\n",
00716             num_backwards, block_number, comp);
00717   }
00718   //else if (num_backwards > 1000) {
00719  else if (num_backwards > 10) {
00720     fprintf(stderr, "Encountered too many (%d) backward time steps in block %d COMP%d data: skipping block.\n",
00721             num_backwards, block_number, comp);
00722     if (!(*bad_block)) {
00723       hCompBackwardsLimit[comp]->Fill(1);
00724       *bad_block = true;
00725     }
00726   }
00727 
00728   // sort the output into time order
00729   sort_hits(output_pointer, output_bank);
00730   
00731   // fill diagnostic histograms
00732   hCompBackwards[comp]->SetBinContent(block_number, num_backwards);
00733   //if (output_pointer > 0){
00734   hCompLastTime[comp]->
00735     SetBinContent(block_number, output_bank[output_pointer-1].time);
00736   //}
00737   return output_pointer;
00738 }
00739 
00740 /*-- subroutine ----------------------------------------------------*/
00741 
00742 void init_comp_histograms(int comp)
00743 {
00744   // This subroutine initializes all comp-specific histograms as needed.
00745     char name[80], title[80];
00746 
00747     sprintf(name, "DAQ_comp%d_error_timing_per_block", comp);
00748     sprintf(title, "COMP %d timing errors vs. block number", comp);
00749     hCompBackwards[comp] = 
00750       new TH1D(name, title, kMaxEvents, 0.5, kMaxEvents+0.5);
00751 
00752     sprintf(name, "DAQ_comp%d_error_timing_limit", comp);
00753     sprintf(title, "Blocks where COMP %d backwards steps exceeded limit", comp);
00754     hCompBackwardsLimit[comp] =
00755       new TH1D(name, title, 3, -0.5, 2.5);
00756 
00757     sprintf(name, "DAQ_comp%d_error_stream_limit", comp);
00758     sprintf(title, "Blocks where COMP %d hits exceeded stream limit", comp);
00759     hCompErrorStreamLimit[comp] =
00760       new TH1D(name, title, 3, -0.5, 2.5);
00761 
00762     sprintf(name, "DAQ_comp%d_last_time", comp);
00763     sprintf(title, "COMP %d last time vs. block number", comp);
00764     hCompLastTime[comp] = 
00765       new TH1D(name, title, kMaxEvents, 0.5, kMaxEvents+0.5);
00766 
00767     comp_histograms_inited[comp] = true;
00768 }
